data.message: Facebook  is a getting people hacked  in too! no more privacy!!

replies.message: Hey Barbara. You own the stuff you share on Facebook. To learn more you can read our terms at: https://www.facebook.com/legal/terms. We also don't sell or share any information that tells an advertiser who you are, and that's not changing. Your trust matters to us. You can see exactly what information we get and how it's used to make Facebook services better here: http://on.fb.me/1eFk4kt. -Chantal

notice how cleverly chantal puts it, key words: "that tells an advertiser who you are". but they do share your information. and they do keep the information themselves of who you are. we also know that this information is available to NSA/FBI/CIA etc. or i guess whoever has enough power and money to retrieve it. so yes, for regular advertising, they won't give away information that may identify you but that doesn't mean that the information isn't being collected and being seen by organizations.
Then don't use if you don't like it. Real simple.
It's all depends on you ,you could limit you could quit
Hey Barbara "password" isn't a good password maybe you should change it and not get hacked next time
I hate how the privacy settings change so much , sometimes things that were set private are changed and you don't even know
If you get hacked, it's because you somehow shared your password. It's not Facebook's fault.
I'm shocked you people could even understand what this chick was trying to say.
Yeah, her comment was almost just a bunch of random words
And you're still on FB because
To have privacy, get off of Facebook. Plain and simple.
